title: Inside chef Gizzi Erskine's kitchen, painted bubblegum pink and with lashings of leopard print
text:
You wouldn’t expect the chef, author, restaurateur and TV personality Gizzi Erskine, known for her bold fashion choices, love of big delicious flavours and general mischievous air, to live in a house decorated in 50 shades of grey.

And after a recent renovation, Erskine’s pink open-plan kitchen is, like its owner, definitely not camera shy. “I wanted to give it a lairy personality, because that’s what I bring,” she laughs.

Erskine bought the apartment in a two-storey warehouse in Dalston, east London, five years ago with her former boyfriend. “[The building] has had various guises over the years,” she says. “Everything from being a pig abattoir to a fridge factory.”

Last year – a busy one for...
description: You wouldn’t expect the chef, author, restaurateur and TV personality Gizzi Erskine, known for her bold fashion choices, love of big delicious flavours and general mischievous air, to live in a house decorated in 50 shades of grey.
